channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description:
Waiting for the next #ComplexityThoughts?In the issue #15 amazing new papers, from #ComplexSystems foundations to #OriginOfLife #SyntheticBiology and #ArtificialIntelligenceUnraveling complexity: building knowledge, one paper at a time!
Not yet subscribed? It's never too late, and it's 100% free.https://manlius.substack.com/p/complexity-thoughts-issue-15

item.title: Minimus
item.description:
quiesco: I rest
Minimus has had a dies negotiosa (busy day) and he's fessus (tired) - he needs a little intermissio (pause) with a potio calida (hot drink)!
#LatinVerbs

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Philip Ball on that weird story about an author who said Nature demanded simplistic narrative re a climate study, when the review record showed the opposite
https://philipball.blogspot.com/2023/09/the-new-climategate-that-wasnt.html
#climate #publishing #Nature

item.title: Caleb Kemere
item.description: Fediverse - message me if you have scientific/open-source interest in the "openmagneto" domain. I've been sitting on it and would love to transfer to a good cause.

item.title: Stone Bear
item.description: #blackmastodon SHOW'EM.

item.title: Mario Zechner
item.description: Today was ... interesting. If you followed me for the past months over on the shitbird site, you might have seen a bunch of angry German words, lots of graphs, and the occassional news paper, radio, or TV snippet with yours truely. Let me explain.In Austria, inflation is way above the EU average. There's no end in sight. This is especially true for basic needs like energy and food.Our government stated in May that they'd build a food price database together with the big grocery chains. But..

item.description: For no reason in particular I made this highly accurate Venn diagram during a college meeting todayhttps://xkcd.com/773/

Tory London mayor candidate liked tweet praising Enoch Powell | The Independent

item.title: Tristan Snell
item.description: BREAKING: Senate investigating Elon Musk over cutting off Starlink satellite internet services to Ukraine during Ukrainian offensive strikes against Russia.Senator Jack Reed, chair of Senate Armed Services Committee, announced the probe.Is Elon Musk helping Putin?

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
Wow! 124 brain researchers call out what journalists call the "leading theory of consciousness" (integrated information theory, IIT) as pseudoscience.https://psyarxiv.com/zsr78/ğŸ’¯â€‹: We need testable theories about the brain to move forward. Every theory starts as a proto-theory (and that's fine). But when theories are not even wrong
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Not_even_wrong
we must acknowledge that. Especially when the stakes are as high as they are here, with big ethical implications (eg for organoids and coma patients, as the authors describe).

item.title: Yogi Jaeger
item.description: New blog post just dropped: "The thing about epistemic humility:" http://www.johannesjaeger.eu/blog/the-thing-about-epistemic-humility.Know when to be humble, and (even more importantly) when to stand up with conviction and call out people's bullshit.

item.title: Snowgaze â„ï¸
item.description: This is "the thread". An Austrian, bothered with the lack of action by government on #inflation , built a software to track supermarkets prices. Then it got interesting. The data shows signs of oligopolic practices, supermarkets having the same price changes at the same time, and how variable prices (same product with or without discount) make it difficult to the consumer to show that prices have increased, while feeling it in their pockets. Read it, it's a great story.https://mastodon.gamedev.place/@badlogic/111071396799790275

item.title: Flashdancer
item.description:
I'm giving up eating chocolate for a month.Sorry, bad punctuation.
Should be:
I'm giving up, eating chocolate for a month.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Feeling a lot of gratitude recently-- towards amazing colleagues who move mountains. "Gratitude is the glue that binds us together, reminding us that we are all part of something greater than ourselves." - Bing

item.title: Primo Natura
item.description: "Substituting half of animal products, such as pork, chicken, beef and milk, consumed globally with more sustainable alternatives could â€œalmost fully haltâ€ the conversion of forests and natural land for agriculture, according to new research."#Food #Agriculture #Trees #Research #Emissionshttps://www.carbonbrief.org/halving-reliance-on-meat-and-dairy-could-could-cut-land-use-emissions-by-31/
